verses.kjv: And Benhadad the king of Syria gathered all his host together: and there were thirty and two kings with him, and horses, and chariots; and he went up and besieged Samaria, and warred against it.
verses.web: Ben Hadad the king of Syria gathered all his army together; and there were thirty-two kings with him, with horses and chariots. He went up and besieged Samaria, and fought against it.
verses.ct: Ben-hadad king of Syria assembled his entire army, along with 32 allied kings and their horses and chariots. He marched against Samaria, laid siege to it, and attacked.

verses.kjv: And he sent messengers to Ahab king of Israel into the city, and said unto him, Thus saith Benhadad,
verses.web: He sent messengers to Ahab king of Israel, into the city, and said to him, “Ben Hadad says,
verses.ct: He sent messengers into the city to Ahab king of Israel with this message: "This is what Ben-hadad says:

verses.kjv: Thy silver and thy gold is mine; thy wives also and thy children, even the goodliest, are mine.
verses.web: ‘Your silver and your gold is mine. Your wives also and your children, even the best, are mine.’ ”
verses.ct: 'Your silver and gold belong to me. Your wives and your best children are mine as well.'"

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel answered and said, My lord, O king, according to thy saying, I am thine, and all that I have.
verses.web: The king of Israel answered, “It is according to your saying, my lord, O king. I am yours, and all that I have.”
verses.ct: The king of Israel replied, "Just as you say, my lord the king — I and everything I have are yours."

verses.kjv: And the messengers came again, and said, Thus speaketh Benhadad, saying, Although I have sent unto thee, saying, Thou shalt deliver me thy silver, and thy gold, and thy wives, and thy children;
verses.web: The messengers came again, and said, “Ben Hadad says, ‘I sent indeed to you, saying, “You shall deliver me your silver, and your gold, and your wives, and your children;
verses.ct: But the messengers came back again and said, "Ben-hadad says: 'I already demanded that you hand over your silver, gold, wives, and children.

verses.kjv: Yet I will send my servants unto thee to morrow about this time, and they shall search thine house, and the houses of thy servants; and it shall be, that whatsoever is pleasant in thine eyes, they shall put it in their hand, and take it away.
verses.web: but I will send my servants to you tomorrow about this time, and they will search your house, and the houses of your servants; whatever is pleasant in your eyes, they will put it in their hand, and take it away.” ’ ”
verses.ct: But now I'm also sending my officials to you tomorrow at this time. They will search your palace and the houses of your servants, and they will seize whatever they find valuable and carry it away.'"

verses.kjv: Then the king of Israel called all the elders of the land, and said, Mark, I pray you, and see how this man seeketh mischief: for he sent unto me for my wives, and for my children, and for my silver, and for my gold; and I denied him not.
verses.web: Then the king of Israel called all the elders of the land, and said, “Please notice how this man seeks mischief; for he sent to me for my wives, and for my children, and for my silver, and for my gold; and I didn’t deny him.”
verses.ct: Ahab summoned all the elders of the land and said, "Look at how this man is pushing for trouble! He demanded my wives, my children, my silver, and my gold — and I agreed to it.

verses.kjv: And all the elders and all the people said unto him, Hearken not unto him, nor consent.
verses.web: All the elders and all the people said to him, “Don’t listen, and don’t consent.”
verses.ct: All the elders and the people told him, "Don't give in. Don't agree to this."

verses.kjv: Wherefore he said unto the messengers of Benhadad, Tell my lord the king, All that thou didst send for to thy servant at the first I will do: but this thing I may not do. And the messengers departed, and brought him word again.
verses.web: Therefore he said to the messengers of Ben Hadad, “Tell my lord the king, ‘All that you sent for to your servant at the first I will do; but this thing I cannot do.’ ” The messengers departed, and brought him back the message.
verses.ct: So Ahab told Ben-hadad's messengers, "Tell my lord the king: 'Everything you demanded the first time, I will do. But this new demand I cannot accept.'" The messengers left and brought the reply back to Ben-hadad.

verses.kjv: And Benhadad sent unto him, and said, The gods do so unto me, and more also, if the dust of Samaria shall suffice for handfuls for all the people that follow me.
verses.web: Ben Hadad sent to him, and said, “The gods do so to me, and more also, if the dust of Samaria will be enough for handfuls for all the people who follow me.”
verses.ct: Ben-hadad sent another message: "May the gods strike me dead and worse if there's enough rubble left in Samaria to fill the hands of all my soldiers!"

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel answered and said, Tell him, Let not him that girdeth on his harness boast himself as he that putteth it off.
verses.web: The king of Israel answered, “Tell him, ‘Don’t let him who puts on his armor brag like he who takes it off.’ ”
verses.ct: The king of Israel shot back, "Tell him this: 'A soldier strapping on his armor shouldn't boast like one who's already won the battle.'"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Ben-hadad heard this message, as he was drinking, he and the kings in the pavilions, that he said unto his servants, Set yourselves in array. And they set themselves in array against the city.
verses.web: When Ben Hadad heard this message, as he was drinking, he and the kings, in the pavilions, he said to his servants, “Prepare to attack!” They prepared to attack the city.
verses.ct: When Ben-hadad heard this reply — he was drinking with the other kings in their shelters — he ordered his men, "Get into attack positions!" So they prepared to assault the city.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there came a prophet unto Ahab king of Israel, saying, Thus saith the LORD, Hast thou seen all this great multitude? behold, I will deliver it into thine hand this day; and thou shalt know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: Behold, a prophet came near to Ahab king of Israel, and said, “LORD says, ‘Have you seen all this great multitude? Behold, I will deliver it into your hand today. Then you will know that I am LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: Just then, a prophet approached Ahab king of Israel and said, "This is what the LORD says: 'Do you see this massive army? I'm going to hand them over to you today, and you will know that I am the LORD.'"

verses.kjv: And Ahab said, By whom? And he said, Thus saith the LORD, Even by the young men of the princes of the provinces. Then he said, Who shall order the battle? And he answered, Thou.
verses.web: Ahab said, “By whom?” He said, “LORD says, ‘By the young men of the princes of the provinces.’ ” Then he said, “Who shall begin the battle?” He answered, “You.”
verses.ct: Ahab asked, "Through whom will you do this?" The prophet answered, "The LORD says, 'Through the young officers serving under the provincial commanders.'" Ahab asked, "Who should lead the attack?" The prophet replied, "You."

verses.kjv: Then he numbered the young men of the princes of the provinces, and they were two hundred and thirty two: and after them he numbered all the people, even all the children of Israel, being seven thousand.
verses.web: Then he mustered the young men of the princes of the provinces, and they were two hundred and thirty-two. After them, he mustered all the people, even all the children of Israel, being seven thousand.
verses.ct: So Ahab assembled the young officers of the provincial commanders — 232 of them. Then he mustered the rest of the Israelite forces, totaling 7,000 men.

verses.kjv: And they went out at noon. But Benhadad was drinking himself drunk in the pavilions, he and the kings, the thirty and two kings that helped him.
verses.web: They went out at noon. But Ben Hadad was drinking himself drunk in the pavilions, he and the kings, the thirty-two kings who helped him.
verses.ct: They marched out at noon. Meanwhile, Ben-hadad was getting drunk in his shelter, along with the 32 kings allied with him.

verses.kjv: And the young men of the princes of the provinces went out first; and Benhadad sent out, and they told him, saying, There are men come out of Samaria.
verses.web: The young men of the princes of the provinces went out first; and Ben Hadad sent out, and they told him, saying, “Men are coming out from Samaria.”
verses.ct: The young officers of the provincial commanders led the charge. Ben-hadad's scouts reported to him, "Men are coming out of Samaria."

verses.kjv: And he said, Whether they be come out for peace, take them alive; or whether they be come out for war, take them alive.
verses.web: He said, “If they have come out for peace, take them alive; or if they have come out for war, take them alive.”
verses.ct: He said, "Whether they've come out to negotiate or to fight, capture them alive."

verses.kjv: So these young men of the princes of the provinces came out of the city, and the army which followed them.
verses.web: So these went out of the city, the young men of the princes of the provinces, and the army which followed them.
verses.ct: The young officers of the provincial commanders marched out of the city, with the main army right behind them.

verses.kjv: And they slew every one his man: and the Syrians fled; and Israel pursued them: and Benhadad the king of Syria escaped on an horse with the horsemen.
verses.web: They each killed his man. The Syrians fled, and Israel pursued them. Ben Hadad the king of Syria escaped on a horse with horsemen.
verses.ct: Each man struck down his opponent. The Syrians broke and ran, and Israel chased them. Ben-hadad king of Syria escaped on horseback with some of his cavalry.

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel went out, and smote the horses and chariots, and slew the Syrians with a great slaughter.
verses.web: The king of Israel went out, and struck the horses and chariots, and killed the Syrians with a great slaughter.
verses.ct: The king of Israel pressed the attack, destroying horses and chariots and inflicting a devastating defeat on the Syrians.

verses.kjv: And the prophet came to the king of Israel, and said unto him, Go, strengthen thyself, and mark, and see what thou doest: for at the return of the year the king of Syria will come up against thee.
verses.web: The prophet came near to the king of Israel, and said to him, “Go, strengthen yourself, and mark, and see what you do; for at the return of the year the king of Syria will come up against you.”
verses.ct: Afterward, the prophet came to the king of Israel and warned him, "Go and regroup. Prepare carefully, because the king of Syria will attack you again next spring."

verses.kjv: And the servants of the king of Syria said unto him, Their gods are gods of the hills; therefore they were stronger than we; but let us fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they.
verses.web: The servants of the king of Syria said to him, “Their god is a god of the hills; therefore they were stronger than we. But let’s fight against them in the plain, and surely we will be stronger than they.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the king of Syria's advisors told him, "Their God is a god of the hills — that's why they overpowered us. But if we fight them on flat ground, we'll surely beat them.

verses.kjv: And do this thing, Take the kings away, every man out of his place, and put captains in their rooms:
verses.web: Do this thing: take the kings away, every man out of his place, and put captains in their place.
verses.ct: Here's what you should do: remove all the kings from their commands and replace them with professional military officers.

verses.kjv: And number thee an army, like the army that thou hast lost, horse for horse, and chariot for chariot: and we will fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they. And he hearkened unto their voice, and did so.
verses.web: Muster an army, like the army that you have lost, horse for horse, and chariot for chariot. We will fight against them in the plain, and surely we will be stronger than they are.” He listened to their voice, and did so.
verses.ct: Then rebuild your army to match the one you lost — horse for horse, chariot for chariot. We'll fight them on the plains, and we'll definitely overpower them." He took their advice and did exactly that.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the return of the year, that Benhadad numbered the Syrians, and went up to Aphek, to fight against Israel.
verses.web: At the return of the year, Ben Hadad mustered the Syrians, and went up to Aphek, to fight against Israel.
verses.ct: The following spring, Ben-hadad mustered the Syrian army and marched to Aphek to fight Israel.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel were numbered, and were all present, and went against them: and the children of Israel pitched before them like two little flocks of kids; but the Syrians filled the country.
verses.web: The children of Israel were mustered and given provisions, and went against them. The children of Israel encamped before them like two little flocks of young goats; but the Syrians filled the country.
verses.ct: The Israelites were also mustered and supplied, and they marched out to face them. The Israelites camped across from the Syrians looking like two small flocks of goats, while the Syrians covered the landscape.

verses.kjv: And there came a man of God, and spake unto the king of Israel, and said, Thus saith the LORD, Because the Syrians have said, The LORD is God of the hills, but he is not God of the valleys, therefore will I deliver all this great multitude into thine hand, and ye shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: A man of God came near and spoke to the king of Israel, and said, “LORD says, ‘Because the Syrians have said, “LORD is a god of the hills, but he is not a god of the valleys;” therefore I will deliver all this great multitude into your hand, and you shall know that I am LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: A man of God approached the king of Israel and said, "This is what the LORD says: 'Because the Syrians have claimed that the LORD is only a god of the hills and not a god of the valleys, I will hand this entire massive army over to you. Then you will know that I am the LORD.'"

verses.kjv: And they pitched one over against the other seven days. And so it was, that in the seventh day the battle was joined: and the children of Israel slew of the Syrians an hundred thousand footmen in one day.
verses.web: They encamped opposite each other for seven days. So it was, that in the seventh day the battle was joined; and the children of Israel killed one hundred thousand footmen of the Syrians in one day.
verses.ct: The two armies camped facing each other for 7 days. On the 7th day, the battle began, and the Israelites killed 100,000 Syrian foot soldiers in a single day.

verses.kjv: But the rest fled to Aphek, into the city; and there a wall fell upon twenty and seven thousand of the men that were left. And Benhadad fled, and came into the city, into an inner chamber.
verses.web: But the rest fled to Aphek, into the city; and the wall fell on twenty-seven thousand men who were left. Ben Hadad fled, and came into the city, into an inner room.
verses.ct: The survivors fled to the city of Aphek, where a wall collapsed on 27,000 of the remaining men. Ben-hadad himself escaped into the city and hid in an inner room.

verses.kjv: And his servants said unto him, Behold now, we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful kings: let us, I pray thee, put sackcloth on our loins, and ropes upon our heads, and go out to the king of Israel: peradventure he will save thy life.
verses.web: His servants said to him, “See now, we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful kings. Please let us put sackcloth on our bodies, and ropes on our heads, and go out to the king of Israel. Maybe he will save your life.”
verses.ct: His servants said to him, "We've heard that the kings of Israel are merciful. Let us wrap sackcloth around our waists and put ropes on our heads, and go out to the king of Israel. Maybe he'll spare your life."

verses.kjv: So they girded sackcloth on their loins, and put ropes on their heads, and came to the king of Israel, and said, Thy servant Benhadad saith, I pray thee, let me live. And he said, Is he yet alive? he is my brother.
verses.web: So they put sackcloth on their bodies and ropes on their heads, and came to the king of Israel, and said, “Your servant Ben Hadad says, ‘Please let me live.’ ” He said, “Is he still alive? He is my brother.”
verses.ct: So they wrapped sackcloth around their waists, put ropes on their heads, and went to the king of Israel. They said, "Your servant Ben-hadad begs you: please let me live." Ahab replied, "Is he still alive? He's like a brother to me."

verses.kjv: Now the men did diligently observe whether any thing would come from him, and did hastily catch it: and they said, Thy brother Benhadad. Then he said, Go ye, bring him. Then Benhadad came forth to him; and he caused him to come up into the chariot.
verses.web: Now the men observed diligently, and hurried to take this phrase; and they said, “Your brother Ben Hadad.” Then he said, “Go, bring him.” Then Ben Hadad came out to him; and he caused him to come up into the chariot.
verses.ct: The men were watching closely for any hopeful sign, and they jumped on his words immediately: "Yes! Your brother Ben-hadad!" Ahab said, "Go get him." So Ben-hadad came out, and Ahab invited him up into his chariot.

verses.kjv: And Ben-hadad said unto him, The cities, which my father took from thy father, I will restore; and thou shalt make streets for thee in Damascus, as my father made in Samaria. Then said Ahab, I will send thee away with this covenant. So he made a covenant with him, and sent him away.
verses.web: Ben Hadad said to him, “The cities which my father took from your father I will restore. You shall make streets for yourself in Damascus, as my father made in Samaria.” “I”, said Ahab, “will let you go with this covenant.” So he made a covenant with him, and let him go.
verses.ct: Ben-hadad said to him, "I'll return the cities my father took from your father. And you may set up market districts for yourself in Damascus, just as my father did in Samaria." Ahab replied, "On those terms, I'll let you go." So he made a covenant with him and released him.

verses.kjv: And a certain man of the sons of the prophets said unto his neighbour in the word of the LORD, Smite me, I pray thee. And the man refused to smite him.
verses.web: A certain man of the sons of the prophets said to his fellow by LORD’s word, “Please strike me!” The man refused to strike him.
verses.ct: One of the sons of the prophets said to a companion, obeying the word of the LORD, "Hit me, please." But the man refused to hit him.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto him, Because thou hast not obeyed the voice of the LORD, behold, as soon as thou art departed from me, a lion shall slay thee. And as soon as he was departed from him, a lion found him, and slew him.
verses.web: Then he said to him, “Because you have not obeyed LORD’s voice, behold, as soon as you have departed from me, a lion will kill you.” As soon as he had departed from him, a lion found him and killed him.
verses.ct: So the prophet told him, "Because you didn't obey the LORD's voice, a lion will kill you the moment you leave me." And as soon as the man walked away, a lion found him and killed him.

verses.kjv: Then he found another man, and said, Smite me, I pray thee. And the man smote him, so that in smiting he wounded him.
verses.web: Then he found another man, and said, “Please strike me.” The man struck him and wounded him.
verses.ct: The prophet found another man and said, "Hit me, please." This man struck him and wounded him.

verses.kjv: So the prophet departed, and waited for the king by the way, and disguised himself with ashes upon his face.
verses.web: So the prophet departed, and waited for the king by the way, and disguised himself with his headband over his eyes.
verses.ct: Then the prophet went and waited for the king along the road, disguising himself with a bandage over his eyes.

verses.kjv: And as the king passed by, he cried unto the king: and he said, Thy servant went out into the midst of the battle; and, behold, a man turned aside, and brought a man unto me, and said, Keep this man: if by any means he be missing, then shall thy life be for his life, or else thou shalt pay a talent of silver.
verses.web: As the king passed by, he cried to the king; and he said, “Your servant went out into the middle of the battle; and behold, a man came over, and brought a man to me, and said, ‘Guard this man! If by any means he is missing, then your life shall be for his life, or else you shall pay a talent of silver.’
verses.ct: As the king passed by, the prophet called out to him: "Your servant was in the thick of battle when a soldier brought me a prisoner and said, 'Guard this man! If he goes missing, you'll pay with your life — or else you'll owe a talent of silver.'

verses.kjv: And as thy servant was busy here and there, he was gone. And the king of Israel said unto him, So shall thy judgment be; thyself hast decided it.
verses.web: As your servant was busy here and there, he was gone.” The king of Israel said to him, “So shall your judgment be. You yourself have decided it.”
verses.ct: But while I was busy with other things, the prisoner escaped." The king of Israel said, "Well, you've pronounced your own sentence. That's your judgment."

verses.kjv: And he hasted, and took the ashes away from his face; and the king of Israel discerned him that he was of the prophets.
verses.web: He hurried, and took the headband away from his eyes; and the king of Israel recognized that he was one of the prophets.
verses.ct: The prophet quickly pulled the bandage from his eyes, and the king recognized him as one of the prophets.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Because thou hast let go out of thy hand a man whom I appointed to utter destruction, therefore thy life shall go for his life, and thy people for his people.
verses.web: He said to him, “LORD says, ‘Because you have let go out of your hand the man whom I had devoted to destruction, therefore your life will take the place of his life, and your people take the place of his people.’ ”
verses.ct: The prophet said to him, "This is what the LORD says: 'Because you released the man I had marked for total destruction, your life will be taken in place of his life, and your people in place of his people.'"

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel went to his house heavy and displeased, and came to Samaria.
verses.web: The king of Israel went to his house sullen and angry, and came to Samaria.
verses.ct: The king of Israel headed home to Samaria, sullen and furious.
